entry.title: WHAT HAPPENED?!
entry.summary: There is a distinct difference between incident occurence in our lives and how we recall those incidents occuring. Our emotional…
entry.content:
There is a distinct difference between incident occurence in our lives and how we recall those incidents occuring. Our emotional state at the time of incident plays a large part in our choice, albeit subconscious, of how we remember incidents and occurences. Emotions can change towards " what happened" for a number of reasons.

Our conscious recollective memoric area of brain can only recall events with lucid clarity for a relatively compromised period of time. The selected emotion affiliated with an incident, perceived as either positive or negative, can also influence our "elected" recollection. Personality types too play a role specifically relative to incidents precipitating fight, flight or freeze responses.

Bottom line; The event which actually occured is vastly different in reality to our experiential response thereunto.

This is what makes my practice, Psycho-Somatic so profound. Using a unique method of separating event from experience of event allows you to recognize events, specifically those that have bothered you, and replace your historic perception of the past with a new, healthy productive memory.

This by no means implies that we remove or alter the past, we simply re-create the way YOU CHOOSE to revisit the past.

BINGO! New perspective on the past, new lease on the future.

entry.content:
It's easy to be ugly when you're insecure, feel threatened and lack confidence. I'ts easy to be ugly when others are succeeding and you're not. It's easy to be ugly when others are living their truth and you're not. It's easy to be ugly when even a poor person seems happy enough. It's easy to be ugly when you feel victimised by life. It's easy to be ugly when the world, in its chaotic state, rips other people to spiritual pieces. It's easu to be ugly when people who are different from the "norm" in terms of colour, creet and gender identification. It's easy to climb on the ugly band wagon and join in the humuliation of innocent people who mean no harm and whose only "sin" is just trying to live in peace albeit with a skew face, a damaged physique, a toothless mouth and an old car.

Live YOUR truth. Rock YOUR truth. Let all others who do no harm live theirs.

The voice of your conscience is what your inner truth sounds like. it tells you who you are, what you should do, how you should live, how you should love. It is the voice that raises red flags, the voice that notifies you of stop streets. This voice is called intuition. It sets the parameter between feeling and thinking. It is your sensible instinct.

The more you listen to this vital voice, the less it speaks. 

Minimize your ego and maximize your sense.
